Posts.Content: Hi Kit-Kat,  I hope this finds you well.  I am now nearly 4 weeks post chemo (I had 12 week taxol). My hair started falling out after the 10th cycle, which was nearly 6 weeks ago, and hasn’t stopped falling out since and I can’t see any regrowth as yet. I also had 4 cycles of AC back in the summer - the 3rd and 4th cycles were delayed and, even though I lost hair back then, it started regrowing so I was surprised it started falling out again as I was told it wouldn’t. Maybe it’s too soon for me to expect hair regrowth but can you please give me an update on your situation - I’m hoping you’re hair regrew and you are feeling better and wondered how long after your last chemo you noticed it? Thank you for any info you can offer, Jane
Posts.Title: Hair still falling out 4 weeks after chemo

Posts.Content: Hi Leolady56, No, of course I don’t mind you mentioning - thank you for your input.  Yeah, I know some of them date back a while but I was replying to someone who posted in April this year, so just wanted to know how they were getting on really... Fingers-crossed my hair will stop falling out soon - although there’s nothing I can do about it and will just have to let nature take its course! Although, 1 minute I’m ok about it, the next I’m a all emotional but I guess that’s just par for the course. Thanks again for getting in touch, I appreciate it. Take care.
